text: How does the author identify himself at the beginning of this short letter?
verseText: The elder to the elect lady and her children, whom I love in truth, and not only I, but also all who know the truth,

text: To whom is this letter addressed, often interpreted as a specific church and its members?
verseText: The elder to the elect lady and her children, whom I love in truth, and not only I, but also all who know the truth,

text: What two interconnected concepts, emphasized throughout the Johannine writings, are central to this letter's greeting and message?
verseText: whom I love in truth... Grace, mercy, and peace will be with us, from God the Father and from Jesus Christ the Father's Son, in truth and love. I rejoiced greatly to find some of your children walking in truth, just as we were commanded by the Father. And this is love, that we walk according to his commandments; this is the commandment, just as you have heard from the beginning, so that you should walk in it.

text: What brought the author great joy regarding the recipients?
options: Finding some of her children walking in the truth
verseText: I rejoiced greatly to find some of your children walking in truth, just as we were commanded by the Father.

text: What commandment, described as not new but 'from the beginning', does the author urge the recipients to follow?
verseText: And now I ask you, dear lady—not as though I were writing you a new commandment, but the one we have had from the beginning—that we love one another.

text: How does the author define love in the context of obedience?
options: That we walk according to His commandments
verseText: And this is love, that we walk according to his commandments; this is the commandment, just as you have heard from the beginning, so that you should walk in it.

text: The author warns that many 'deceivers' have gone out into the world. What specific false teaching does he highlight?
options: Denying that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh
verseText: For many deceivers have gone out into the world, those who do not confess the coming of Jesus Christ in the flesh. Such a one is the deceiver and the antichrist.

text: What term does the author use to describe someone who promotes this false teaching about Christ?
verseText: For many deceivers have gone out into the world, those who do not confess the coming of Jesus Christ in the flesh. Such a one is the deceiver and the antichrist.

text: What warning does the author give believers regarding their spiritual progress?
options: To watch themselves, so they don't lose what they've worked for
To focus only on the future
verseText: Watch yourselves, so that you may not lose what we have worked for, but may win a full reward.

text: What is the consequence for anyone who 'goes on ahead' and does not abide in the teaching of Christ?
options: They are praised for their innovation
verseText: Everyone who goes on ahead and does not abide in the teaching of Christ, does not have God. Whoever abides in the teaching has both the Father and the Son.

text: What specific instruction does the author give regarding hospitality towards those who bring false teaching?
options: Do not receive them into your house or give them any greeting
verseText: If anyone comes to you and does not bring this teaching, do not receive him into your house or give him any greeting,

text: Why does the author issue such a strong warning against even greeting those who teach falsely?
options: Because whoever greets them takes part in their wicked works
Because it is forbidden by Roman law
Because they might be carrying disease
verseText: for whoever greets him takes part in his wicked works.

text: Instead of writing everything with paper and ink, what does the author hope to do?
options: Visit the recipients and speak face to face
verseText: Though I have much to write to you, I would rather not use paper and ink. Instead I hope to come to you and talk face to face, so that our joy may be complete.

text: What is the desired outcome of the author visiting and speaking face to face?
options: That they might solve a dispute
That their joy may be complete
That they can plan a new ministry
That he can collect an offering
verseText: Though I have much to write to you, I would rather not use paper and ink. Instead I hope to come to you and talk face to face, so that our joy may be complete.

text: From whom does the final greeting in the letter come?
options: The children of your elect sister
verseText: The children of your elect sister greet you.

text: This letter emphasizes the need to balance which two Christian virtues?
verseText: Grace, mercy, and peace will be with us, from God the Father and from Jesus Christ the Father's Son, in truth and love. And this is love, that we walk according to his commandments; this is the commandment, just as you have heard from the beginning, so that you should walk in it.
